The Clinton Health Access Initiative: CHAI) was established in 2002 with the primary goal of bringing down the price of AIDS medicines, making it unlikely that they would distribute ineffective drugs.
The Daily Caller article focuses on the: s dealings with the Indian generic drugmaker Ranbaxy, which has faced past allegations of falsifying test results and cutting corners in the production process. However, none of these allegations were related to HIV/AIDS drugs.
The initiative: s model of bringing together drug buyers and generic drug makers has successfully reduced the price of HIV/AIDS treatment and remains an essential part of the worldwide supply chain. This suggests that the initiative is committed to providing effective drugs to patients.
